content.question: Which of the following is the strongest evidence supporting the endosymbiont hypothesis?

choices.label: Mitochondria have their own <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and divide independently of the cell.
Mitochondria can carry out hydrolytic reactions on organic molecules.
Mitochondria have a highly folded membrane.
Mitochondria are found in both plants and animals.

content.answer: Mitochondria have their own <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and divide independently of the cell.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from biological principles, concepts, processes, and data.
